greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Obtained from sequence of lucky numbers (A000959) by taking iterated absolute value differences of terms and extracting the leading diagonal.
comment: The classical Gilbreath-Proth Conjecture is that when iterated absolute differences are formed from the sequence of primes, the leading diagonal is 2,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,... (see A036262). This is an analog for the lucky numbers sequence.
reference: H. W. Gould, Gilbreath-Proth type sequence generated from Lucky numbers, unpublished.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
program: (\lds -> map abs $ zipWith (-) (tail lds) lds) a000959_list
results.author: _Henry Gould_, May 29 2000
